title: Electronics Warranty Plan | Consumer Protection Agency

hero.title: Electronics Warranty Plan
hero.text: Get the best in warranty protection with our Consumer Protection warranty plan.

text.p: We offer a wide range of plans to protect almost anything you own. Our plans have flexible and transparent contracts with no long-term commitment or hidden fees. Our claims process is easy, just give us a call and we will get back to you in no time. Join thousands of our happy customers to enjoy the best services in the industry and save thousands on repair and replacement bills.

The Consumer Protection Team is changing the dynamics and transforming the world of consumer protection plans. We hit two birds with one stone. We give you coverage for both the electronic devices that you have recently bought and those which you have owned, all under one plan. From TVs to gaming consoles, we’ve got your back. Home theatre systems, computers, small appliances, you name it. Our plan gives you a safe roof for all your electronics.
Our Electronics Warranty Plan isn’t going to tempt you in with a low monthly fee and then slam you with a big deductible. The deductible our electronics warranty plan is a standard $25 per claim.
You can also add Accidental Damage Coverage to your laptops, tablets, and smartphones so that you’re covered if they fall to the floor or drop into water.

subtitleText.title: Get the peace of mind you've always wanted with a coverage that adequately suits your needs

text.p: If you sit down to make a list of every type of electronics in your house from the biggest right down to the smallest, you are suddenly going to realize that you actually do have a lot of devices that you need to use regularly. From laptops, phones to TVs, there are so many devices we own that make our lives so much easier. What becomes of us then, when one of our devices completely stops working or gets damaged? Does this mean that life stops when our devices do? It really does not have to be this way.

list.li: Cover an unlimited number of electronics
Pay-as-you-go protection plan with no long-term contract
Unlimited claims and hassle free service
Local repairs so you don’t have to worry about wasting time shipping your electronics out
Plans are easily transferable to new items

text.p: Protection for products brands. We offer protection for an unlimited number of eligible new and existing products/brands.
We boast of a 98% Zip-Code coverage for In-Home service.
File a claim. Shipping is included. We’ll repair it and send it back, typically within 24 hours.

list.li: All mechanical/electrical breakdowns due to normal use
All mechanical/electrical breakdowns due to normal use
Cover a combination of any three devices of your choice – smartphones, tablets or laptops.
No long-term contracts – just a simple monthly protection plan
Any working device is eligible for protection regardless of brand or age
Local, same-day repairs so you do not have to stay long without your devices
Covers accidental damage and damage caused by liquids
Cancel your plan anytime without any penalties or hidden fees.
Plans are readily transferable to new or upgraded gadgets

text.p: For one low monthly fee, our electronics warranty plan covers mechanical failures and electrical failures that occur during normal use, and accidental damage from drops and spills. The plan covers those repairs necessary to return your device to its intended functionality under normal operation. Our electronics warranty plan covers any mechanical or electronic  failures arising from any accidental damage from spills or drops or during normal use for a small monthly fee. The plan covers the repairs needed to restore your device to its full functionality.

Once you enroll, you’ll need to register your eligible devices. These include ones that you’ve purchased within the last 24 months. These devices must be registered within 30 days of your electronic warranty plan activation date. All future purchases must be registered within 30 days of their purchase date. Be sure to keep all of your receipts.

You’ll need to enroll your eligible devices once  you’ve joined, which include any devices that you’ve bought in the recent 24 months. These devices should be registered within 30 days of the activation date of your electronic warranty plan. For any future electronics, register them within 30 days of their purchase and make a point of keeping a receipt for this and generally other electronics you purchase.

accordion.title: What’s the difference between your Electronics Warranty Plan and service plans offered by retailers?

text.p: A retailer’s plan is costly and only covers the newly gadget for a limited period of time. Retailers usually sell you a new plan for each purchase, and these plans frequently cost more than 20% of the device’s initial price. The electronic warranty plan is a  low-cost option that covers all of your registered gadgets.
You cancel your plan any time by either calling customer service or logging to user account and cancel.

accordion.title: Does it matter where I bought my device?

text.p: Any brand from any retailer is covered by the Electronics Warranty Plan.

accordion.title: Who repairs my device if it breaks?

text.p: Only approved service repair personnel are allowed to fix your damaged product. Our electronics warranty plan offers you the same level of assistance that you would receive from the product’s manufacturer or seller, if not higher.

accordion.title: How long are my products covered?

text.p: As long as you pay the small monthly fee, your coverage will never expire.

accordion.title: What consumer electronics products are eligible for coverage?

text.p: The following items fall under our electronics warranty program: laptops, smartphones, tablets, monitors, eReaders, printers, televisions, game consoles, desktops, cameras, home audio, car audio, video equipment, home theaters, accessories, Mp3 players and alarm clocks.

accordion.title: Is there a cover for accidental damage if I drop my phone or the screen cracks?

text.p: Yes. Accidental damage is covered on all your registered devices.

accordion.title: What happens if I need service?

text.p: When a registered product has to be repaired, call our customer service department.. We have a chain of service repair centers ready to help you with your problem. If the cost of repairing your product surpasses the amount you initially paid for it, or if it can’t be restored because the parts are no longer available or the cost of repair is too steep, you may be eligible for a replacement payment of up to the original buying price (excluding sales tax) of the product.

accordion.title: Is there a deductible during repair?

text.p: Yes. The deductible for the our electronics warranty plan is $25 per claim.

accordion.title: Do I need to keep my receipts?

text.p: Yes. Please remember to keep all of your receipts since a copy of your receipt for the device may be required when requesting repair assistance.

accordion.title: How do I ask for a repair service request if something breaks?

text.p: To submit a service request, dial customer  service. When requesting a repair, you may be asked to produce a copy of your original purchase receipt.
